answers.answer: Hi,I have a few suggestions for him. Firstly, he should get his blood sugar checked as he’s urinating frequently and this is one of the earliest signs of diabetes. Also diabetes can decrease the sexual drive of a person. Secondly, he should get an ultrasound done of the urinary tract to rule out the possibility of a stone in the urinary tract as well as any obstruction by the enlarged prostate. Thee possibilities need to be ruled out before one thinks of anything else. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care.

Thank you for taking time to read and respond to my question/concern.  I will certainly suggest my boyfriend to have these things checked out.  I did not mention his age; 52.  Also, do you or does anyone else out there reading this have a theory about why he needs this very constant steady pressure in the groin and testicle area with the heel of foot, knee or palm of hand in order to "eventually" reach ejaculation?  It's important to say that we've been together 5 years and it's always been this way from the first time.  It's getting worse though.  And the frequent peeing is not just through the night.  He has to pee almost every hour on the hour; sometimes he needs to pee less than a half hour after peeing.  He keeps a bottle next to him in the car when he knows he's going to be on the road more than an hour.  Please help me gather more information in order to persuade him to see a urologist!  Thank you so much out there.

question: My unprofessional "guess" is that prostate problems are playing into the problem I will describe for you.  My boyfriend of 5 years has never been able to ejaculate normally inside me.  He requiers strong pressure applied with the heel of the hand or the side of my leg to his scrotom area to the point of my thinking I must be hurting him.  It has to go on and on and on before we begin to get anywhere.  He struggles to "get there."  I work up a sweat and get hand or leg cramps from pressing and manipulating the groin area.  It's a chore.  He sometimes has to just give it up.  When we are successful it's a violent and somewhat painful thing; "hurts so good" if-you-will.  No wonder he doesn't want to have sex very often.  He has to pee every hour it seems.  He gets up to pee no less than 2 times per night.  He groans when he pees.  He once had normal sex with his wife he is divorced from.  They had 2 kids.  He has never ejaculated inside me.  I've been patient and tried to except this as "normal" for us.  But now that he only gives in to having sex with me maybe once every 8 weeks I am really getting fed up.  What can I say to him to make him realize how important it is for him to see a urologist?  He CAN'T be happy feeling this way!  Is there hope for reversing all of this and having a normal sex life again some day?
title: this isn't normal!
